Retinaldehyde dehydrogenase 2 (RALDH2) is an enzyme that in humans is encoded by the ALDH1A2 gene＆#46
column2: This protein belongs to the aldehyde dehydrogenase family of proteins＆#46
column3: The product of this gene is an enzyme that catalyzes the synthesis of retinoic acid (RA) from retinaldehyde＆#46
column4: Retinoic acid, the active derivative of vitamin A (retinol), is a paracrine hormone signaling molecule that functions in developing and adult tissues＆#46
column5: The studies of a similar mouse gene suggest that this enzyme and the cytochrome CYP26A1, concurrently establish local embryonic retinoic acid levels that facilitate posterior organ development and prevent spina bifida＆#46
column6: Three transcript variants encoding distinct isoforms have been identified for this gene＆#46
column9: Sensitivity: ALDH1A2 antibody detects endogenous levels of total ALDH1A2 protein＆#46
column12: Immunogen: The antiserum was produced against synthesized peptide derived from internal of human ALDH1A2＆#46
column14: purified from rabbit antiserum by affinity＆#45
column17: Form of Antibody: Rabbit IgG in phosphate buffered saline (without Mg2＆#43
column27: For maximum recovery of the product, centrifuge the original vial after thawing and before removing the cap＆#46
column28: Aliquot to avoid repeated freezing and thawing＆#46
